snippet: In the second trial over a device recalled in 2010, a jury rejected claims that the manufacturer inappropriately marketed a defective product.
abstract: Chicago jury rejects claims that DePuy Orthopaedics unit of Johnson & Johnson inappropriately marketed an artificial hip, which the company recalled in 2010; verdicts comes in the second trial of some 10,000 pending lawsuits involving the medical device known as the Articular Surface Replacement, or ASR.
lead_paragraph: In the second trial over a device recalled in 2010, a jury rejected claims that the manufacturer inappropriately marketed a defective product.

headline.seo: J.&J. Wins Court Challenge Over Hip Device
headline.main: J.&J. Prevails in Defending Its Marketing of Hip Device
headline.print_headline: J.&J. Prevails In Defending Its Marketing Of Hip Device
